channel.title: Hosting Problem
channel.description:
Ok, so i portforwarded, naming it RsServer, makign the ports from and to 43594, protocal is tcp and its to the ip adress 192.168.1.100
Then i got the no-ip thing, enabled it
Ran my server
Told people to log on, using the no-ip and my ip, but they said it didnt work.
Im wondering what i did or didnt do, if someone could help that would be great
Thanks, Wookiezz

item.title: Hosting Problem
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

It seems you’ve used your default gateway IP as your IPv4 address? :rolleyes:

When you sign up to no-ip yeah, you should’ve created a server ip there, which is the IPv4 address.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Sp3ke wrote:

It’s really hard to help with things like these as nobodys got a clue on what you’ve done / haven’t done / where you have went wrong.

Have you got teamviewer and I’ll take a look?
